0: A woman who went missing while snowboarding in Whistler, British Columbia, was found in good condition today after three days lost "in the backcountry," according to the police. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The snowboarder was found by search and rescue teams this afternoon, the Whistler Royal Canadian Mounted Police said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR She was "in cold, but good, condition," police said, and she was taken by helicopter for medical treatment. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The snowboarder, identified as 21-year-old Julie Abrahamsen, had last been seen Wednesday morning on Blackcomb Mountain, according to police. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR She was reported missing on Friday, igniting a police and ski patrol search. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Tracks were spotted in the snow by searchers in a helicopter, and when rescuers on the ground followed them, they found the young woman, Whistler RCMP Sgt. Rob Knapton said.
